BiocGF 0.0.3
  • Get started
  • Reference

    returns instance of geneformer.Classifier

    setup_and_run_Classifier.Rd

    returns instance of geneformer.Classifier

    setup_and_run_Classifier(
  input_data_file,
  output_directory,
  output_prefix,
  split_id_list,
  classifier,
  cell_state_dict,
  filter_data,
  training_args,
  max_ncells,
  freeze_layers,
  num_crossval_splits,
  forward_batch_size,
  nproc,
  base_model_dir,
  val_split_id_list
)

    Arguments

    input_data_file

    character(1) path to a `.datasets` folder loadable by huggingface `datasets` module

    output_directory

    character(1) folder that will be populated with fine tuning test and train outcome resources. For the heart failure example, 2.2 GB of results are produced, possibly inefficient owing to caching practices.

    output_prefix

    character(1) tag prepended (or postfixed) to certain generated resources

    split_id_list

    an R list() with components `attr_key`, `train` and `test`

    classifier

    character(1) defaults to "cell", see sources of python modules for options (:-()

    cell_state_dict

    an R list() of cell type tags, with 'name' corresponding to the name used in the tokenized base data (h5ad or loom)

    filter_data

    a list of e.g., cell type tags, that will be analyzed

    training_args

    a list with such components as `num_train_epochs` and `learning_rate` -- look fo authoritative doc

    max_ncells

    integer(1)

    freeze_layers

    integer(1) seek authoritative doc

    num_crossval_splits

    integer(1)

    forward_batch_size

    integer(1)

    nproc

    integer(1) concerning parallelization

    base_model_dir

    character(1) path to safetensors representation of model

    val_split_id_list

    list() with elements `attr_key`, `train`, `eval`

    Value

    a list with information on accuracy

    Note

    We pick up the Geneformer package frozen with BiocGF. `token_dictionary.pkl` must be present in working dir

    Contents

    Developed by Vince Carey.
